answers.answer: Ditto. My due date didn't change. I think it means we gained too much weight too fast, but I don't really know why I'm measuring big either lol.

My doctor told me that last week, and we had already ruled out diabetes.  I see the high risk doctors as well and when I seen them they said yes on the outside I'm measuring ahead but the baby was still measuring on time. They said my due date was still the same.
At 27 weeks I was measuring 2 weeks ahead, now at 30 I'm normal. My baby just had a growth spurt and now slowed down again

The same thing is going on with me rite now I'm 35w 6d but uterus measured one or two weeks ahead I go to the doctor Tuesday and have my 36w ultrasound hoping they move my day.. it doesn't mean ur gain too much weight because I have gained a pound and I measure that... I'll post so yall will know for sure. ..

I don't believe they move your due date at this point but I measured 30 weeks at my 28 week appointment and I measured myself this am (30 weeks) and I think it was 32-33... I have another checkup in the morning so we will see if I'm right
Yeah I have only gained 11 pounds my doctor said I haven't gained to much weight I just think baby had her growth spurt . :)
same thing here.measuring 2 weeks ahead!!!! Doc say she is estimated between 8 to 9 lb by dd
Same here Dr says I'm a wk ahead but no sign of labor ***** wish i was at least showing some sign my bby grl is on the way
I was measuring 3 weeks ahead and now 5. Had an ultrasound and I just have a lot of extra fluid.

question: On my last appointment my doctor told me I was measuring larger so instead of 25 weeks he said I should be 27 weeks . He didn't tell me if my due date changed or anything . Has this happend to anyone else and if so were you actually 2 weeks further along ?
title: Measuring bigger
